statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Hampton 83, Howard 72
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Christopher Tolson came off the bench to score 20 points as Hampton overcame a sluggish second half to post an 83-72 victory over Howard on Thursday night, wrapping up second place in the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference. Tolson came into the game averaging just 3.2 points per game, but was 7 of 10 from the floor and 4 of 7 from 3-point range to spark the Pirates (21-8, 11-5). The Bison (6-23, 4-12) trailed by 14 at halftime, but a 20-8 run capped by Alphonso Leary's layup got Howard to 44-42 with 14:27 remaining. Hampton answered with a 14-2 run of its own, keyed by 3s from Tolson and Darrion Pellum, to take control of the contest. Pellum scored 21 points and Kwame Morgan added 17 points for the Pirates, while Anton Dickerson led the Bison with 21 points. Hampton jumped out to a 10-0 lead to open the game. Tolson later went on a 10-0 run all by himself in a 1:05 span as the Pirates built a 24-9 lead, taking the rowdy crowd -- which included Washington Wizards players John Wall, JaVale McGee and Andray Blatche -- out of the game. Tolson was part of a big effort from the Pirates' bench, which held a 32-5 scoring advantage. The Pirates also hit a season-high 15 3-pointers to earn the No. 2 seed in next week's MEAC conference tournament in Winston-Salem, N.C. Howard rallied early in the second half, getting four straight three-point possessions to nearly erase the halftime deficit, but never held the lead in dropping its third straight contest and ensuring a last-place conference finish.
